meanings.definition: A process in which cold, nutrient-rich water from the ocean depths rises to the surface.
meanings.sent1: The upwelling brought important nutrients to the surface.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the upwelling to understand its impact on marine life.
meanings.sent3: The upwelling decided to take a detour and surprise the fish near the shore.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter bubbled up like an upwelling of joy.
meanings.sent5: The upwelling of emotions overwhelmed him as he gazed at the vast ocean.

meanings.definition: The act of moving upwards or rising.
meanings.sent1: The upwelling of the hot air made the balloon rise higher.
meanings.sent2: The upwelling of happiness in her heart was contagious.
meanings.sent3: The upwelling of bubbles in the soda made it fizz over.
meanings.sent4: His spirits experienced an upwelling of hope after the good news.
meanings.sent5: The upwelling of music from the street performers filled the square with joy.

meanings.definition: A current of cold, nutrient-rich water that moves upwards in the ocean.
meanings.sent1: The upwelling near the coast supported a thriving ecosystem.
meanings.sent2: Fishermen knew to look for signs of upwelling to find the best fishing spots.
meanings.sent3: The upwelling of water surprised the divers with its chilly embrace.
meanings.sent4: The upwelling of nutrients sustained a diverse range of marine life.
meanings.sent5: The upwelling of cold water refreshed the surface of the ocean, bringing life to the barren areas.
